tit.cmt: 両界曼荼羅（りょうかいまんだら）→Ryokai-mandara, mandala of the two realms
mandalaとし（以下同様）、補足しました。

sen.j: 両界曼荼羅（りょうかいまんだら）は、密教の中心となる仏である大日如来の説く真理や悟りの境地を、視覚的に表現した曼荼羅である。
sen.e: Ryokai-mandara is a mandara which visually depicts the truth and the state of Satori that is advocated by Dainichinyorai, principal Budha in Esoteric Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 密教→Mikkyo, Esoteric Buddhism[http://www.koyasan.or.jp/english/shingonshu/mikkyo.html]大日如来→Dainichinyorai悟り→Satori, enlightenment[英辞郎 on the WEB]曼荼羅→Mandara
sen.e: Ryokai-mandara is a mandara which visually depicts the truth and the state of Satori that is advocated by Dainichinyorai, principal Budha in Esoteric Buddhism.
Ryokai-mandala is a mandala which visually depicts the truth and the state of enlightenment that is advocated by Dainichi Nyorai (Mahavairocana), principal Buddha in Esoteric Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 用語修正、補足しました。

sen.j: 大日如来を中心とした数々の「仏」を一定の秩序にしたがって配置したものであり、「胎蔵曼荼羅」（胎蔵界曼荼羅とも）、「金剛界曼荼羅」の2つの曼荼羅を合わせて「両界曼荼羅」または「両部曼荼羅」と称する。
sen.e: Mandara is the one in which a lot of "Buddha", including Dainichinyorai, are arranged in accordance with a cirtain fixed order and two mandara, namely Garbha-mandala (also called Taizokai-mandara) and Vajradhatumandala, are collectively called Ryokai-mandara or Ryoubu mandara.
sen.cmt: 胎蔵曼荼羅（胎蔵界曼荼羅とも）→Garbha-mandala[http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110002660727/]金剛界曼荼羅→Vajradhatumandala[http://ci.nii.ac.jp/naid/110002662145/]両部曼荼羅→Ryoubu mandara, mandala of the two division 胎蔵界曼荼羅→Taizokai-mandara[定訳不明]
sen.e: Mandara is the one where many "Buddha", including Dainichinyorai, are arranged in accordance with a certain fixed order and two mandara, namely Garbha-mandala (also called Taizokai-mandara) and Vajradhatumandala, are collectively called Ryokai-mandara or Ryoubu mandara.

Mandala is the one where many 'Buddha,' including Dainichi Nyorai, are arranged in accordance with a certain fixed order and two mandala, namely Garbha-mandala (also called Taizokai-mandala) and Vajradhatu-mandala, are collectively called Ryokai-mandala or Ryoubu mandala.

sen.e: Other than the ones which depict individual image of Buddha in painting, some depict one Buddha symbolically by one Sanskrit script (a kind of letters which used for writing Sanskrit).

tit.j: 両界曼荼羅の起源と日本伝来

sen.j: 胎蔵曼荼羅（大悲胎蔵生曼荼羅）は「大毘盧遮那成仏神変加持経」、金剛界曼荼羅は「金剛頂経」という密教経典をもとに描かれている。
sen.e: Garbha-mandala (Daihitaizosho mandara) is drawn based on Esoteric Buddhism scriptures called "Daibirushanabutsu-Jimpenkaji-kyo Sutra" and Vajradhatumandala is drawn based on Esoteric Buddhism scriptures called "Kongocho-kyo Sutra".

sen.j: 大日経は7世紀の中頃、インドで成立したものと言われ、インド出身の僧・善無畏（ぜんむい、637年 － 735年）が弟子の一行（いちぎょう、683年 － 727年）とともに8世紀前半の725年（開元13年）前後に漢訳（当時の中国語に翻訳）したものである。
sen.e: Dainichi-kyo Sutra is believed to have been established in India in the middle of 7th century and it was translated into Kanji character (translated into then Chinese language) around the year of 725 in the early 8th century (13th year of Kaigen) by Zenmui (683 -735), a native Indian monk, along with his desciple Ichigyo (683-727).

sen.e: Dainichi-kyo Sutra is believed to have been established in India in the middle of the 7th century and it was translated into Kanji characters (translated into the then Chinese language) around the year of 725 in the early 8th century (13th year of Kaigen) by Zenmui (683 -735), a native Indian monk, along with his desciple Ichigyo (683-727).

Dainichi-kyo Sutra (Mahavairocana Sutra) is believed to have been established in India in the middle of the 7th century and it was translated into Kanji characters (translated into the then Chinese language) around 725 in the early 8th century by Zenmui (683 - 735), a native Indian monk, along with his disciple Ichigyo (683 - 727).

sen.j: 一方の金剛頂経は7世紀末から8世紀始めにかけてインドで成立したもので、大日経が訳されたのと同じ頃に、インド出身の僧・金剛智（671年 － 741年）と弟子の不空（705年 －774年）によって漢訳されている。
sen.e: On the other hand, Kongocho-kyo Sutra is believed to have been established in India during the period from the end of 7th century till early 8th century and was translated into Kanji character around the same time with the translation of Dainichi-kyo Sutra by Kongochi (671-741), a native Indian monk, along with his desciple Fuku (705-774).

On the other hand, Kongocho-kyo Sutra is believed to have been established in India during the period from the end of 7th century till early 8th century and was translated into Kanji characters around the same time with the translation of Dainichi-kyo Sutra by Kongochi (671-741), a native Indian monk, along with his desciple Fuku (705-774).

sen.j: なお、金剛頂経は、十八会（じゅうはちえ）、つまり、大日如来が18のさまざまな機会に説いた説法を集大成した膨大なものであるが、金剛智と不空が訳したのは、そのうちの初会（しょえ）のみである。
sen.e: Although the volume of Kongocho-kyo Sutra is so huge since it compiled all the teachings that Dainichinyorai advocated on 18 various occasions, collectively called Jyuhachi-e, the one which Kongochi and Fuku translated is the teachings advocated on first occasion, called Sho-e, only.

sen.j: いずれにしても、「大日経」と「金剛頂経」は同じ大日如来を主尊としながらも系統の違う経典であり、違う時期にインドの別々の地方で別個に成立し、中国へも別々に伝わった。
sen.e: At any rate, despite of the fact that both "Dainichi-kyo Sutra" and "Kongocho-kyo Sutra" share Dainichinyorai as their common principal Budha, these two are scriptures of different lineage which were established independently in different regions of India at different times and were introduced into China seperately.

sen.j: これら2つの経の教えを統合し、両界曼荼羅という形にまとめたのは、空海の師である唐僧・恵果（746年 － 805年）であると推定されている。
sen.e: It is presumed that Eka (746-805), a monk in Tang dynasty era and was Kukai's mentor, integrated the teachings of two scriptures into Ryokai-mandara.

sen.j: 恵果は、密教の奥義は言葉では伝えることがかなわぬとして、唐の絵師に命じて両界曼荼羅を描かせ、空海に与えた。
sen.e: As Eka thought it impossible to orally transmit in-depth teachings of Esoteric Buddhism, he made a Tang painter draw Ryokai-mandara and gave it to Kukai.

sen.j: 空海は唐での留学を終えて806年（大同 (日本)元年）帰国した際、それらの曼荼羅を持ち帰っている。
sen.e: Kukai took back such mandara when he returned home in 806 after finishing his study in Tang.

sen.e: Although the original which Kukai took back was lost, the copy which is believed to be quite similar to the original is preserved at Jingo-ji Temple in Kyoto, known as national treasury Ryokai-mandara (commonly called Takao-mandara).

sen.j: その中心に位置するのが「中台八葉院」であり、8枚の花弁をもつ蓮の花の中央に胎蔵界大日如来（腹前で両手を組む「法界定印」を結ぶ）が位置する。
sen.e: What is located in the center is "the central eight-Petal Court" and Taizokai Dainichinyorai (who is in a posture of "Hokkai Join" with folding both hands in front of the belly) is sitting on the center of a lotus flower with 8 petals.

sen.j: 大日如来の周囲には4体の如来（宝幢－ほうどう、開敷華王－かいふけおう、阿弥陀如来－むりょうじゅ、天鼓雷音－てんくらいおん）と4体の菩薩（普賢菩薩、文殊菩薩、観音菩薩、弥勒菩薩）、計8体が表わされる。
sen.e: Around Dainichinyorai, all of 8 statues, namely 4 of Nyorai (Hodo, Kaifukeo, Amidanyorai-Muryoju and Tenkuraion) and 4 of Bosatsu (Fugen Bosatsu, Monju Bosatsu, Kannon Bosatsu and Miroku Bosatsu), are depicted.

sen.j: なお、通常日本に取り入れられた曼荼羅の呼称について胎蔵界曼荼羅・胎蔵曼荼羅の2つが併用されているが、密教学者・頼富本宏は『曼荼羅の美術 東寺の曼荼羅を中心として』において「曼荼羅の典拠となった大日経と金剛頂経のいわゆる両部の大経を意識したものであり、空海もこの用語（注両部曼荼羅）のみを用いている」「即ち金剛頂経には、明確に金剛界曼荼羅を説くのに対して、大日経では大悲胎蔵曼荼羅もしくは胎蔵生曼荼羅を説くのにかかわらず、胎蔵界曼荼羅と言う表現は見られないからである」と書いている。
sen.e: As for the naming of mandara, both Taizokai-mandara and Garbha-mandala are used in Japan but Motohiro YORITOMI, a researcher of Esoteric Buddhism, wrote in his book titled "Architectures of mandara-centering on mandara at To-ji Temple" as "the name of mandara was created in consideration of both Dainichi-kyo Sutra and Kongocho-kyo Sutra, collectively called Ryobu Sutra and both are the source of mandara, and Kukai used only this name (note: Ryobu-mandara)" "because Kongocho-kyo Sutra clearly uses Vajradhatumandala, Dainichi-kyo Sutra doesn't use the name of Taizokai-mandara though it uses Daihitaizosho mandara or Garbha-mandala".

sen.j: また頼富本宏は、円仁･円珍・安然など天台密教（台密）が興隆すると修法のテキストにあたる次第類の中に「胎蔵界」と言う表現が用いられるようになり、両界曼荼羅・胎蔵界曼荼羅の語が使われるようになったとする。
sen.e: Motohiro YORITOMI further asserts that with the development of Tendai Mikkyo (Daimitsu) thanks to Ennin, Enchin and Annen, the term of "Taizokai" was widly used in the text for prayer and austerities and as a result, the terms of Ryokai-mandara and Taizokai mandara came into use.

Motohiro YORITOMI further asserts that with the development of Tendai Esoteric Buddhism (Daimitsu) thanks to Ennin, Enchin and Annen, the term of 'Taizokai' (the Womb Realm) was widely used in the text for prayer and austerities and as a result, the terms of Ryokai-mandala and Taizokai-mandala came into use.

sen.j: 中台八葉院の周囲には、遍知院、持明院、釈迦院、虚空蔵院、文殊院、蘇悉地（そしつじ）院、蓮華部院、地蔵院、金剛手院、除蓋障（じょがいしょう）院が、それぞれ同心円状にめぐり、これらすべてを囲む外周に外金剛部（げこんごうぶ）院、またの名は最外（さいげ）院が位置する。
sen.e: The central eight-Petal Court is surrounded by Henchi-in, Jimyo-in Temple, Shaka-in, Kokuzo-in, Monju-in, Soshituji-in, Rengebu-in, Jizo-in, Kongoshu-in Temple and Jogaisho-in in a concentric fashion and Gekongobu-in, also called Saige-in, is located at the outer circumference that encircles all of the above.
sen.cmt: 遍知院→Henchi-in持明院→Jimyo-in Temple釈迦院→Shaka-in虚空蔵院→Kokuzo-in文殊院→Monju-in蘇悉地（そしつじ）院→Soshitsuji-in蓮華部院→Rengebu-in地蔵院→Jizo-in金剛手院→Kongoshu-in Temple除蓋障（じょがいしょう）院→Jogaisho-in外金剛部（げこんごうぶ）院→Gekongobu-in最外（さいげ）院→Saige-in
sen.e: The central eight-Petal Court is surrounded by Henchi-in, Jimyo-in Temple, Shaka-in, Kokuzo-in, Monju-in, Soshituji-in, Rengebu-in, Jizo-in, Kongoshu-in Temple and Jogaisho-in in a concentric fashion and Gekongobu-in, also called Saige-in, is located at the outer circumference that encircles all of the above.

The central eight-Petal Court is surrounded by Henchi-in, Jimyo-in, Shaka-in (Court of Shaka Nyorai), Kokuzo-in (Court of Kokuzo Bosatsu (Akasagarbha Bodhisattva), Monju-in (Court of Monju Bosatsu (Manjusri)), Soshituji-in, Rengebu-in, Jizo-in (Court of Jizo Bosatsu (Jizo Bodhisattva)), Kongoshu-in and Jogaisho-in in a concentric fashion and Gekongobu-in, also called Saige-in, is located at the outer circumference that encircles all of the above.

sen.j: これは、内側から外側へ向かう動きを暗示し、大日如来の抽象的な智慧が、現実世界において実践されるさまを表現するという。
sen.e: This suggests the movement from inner side to outer side and represents the transformation of Dainichinyorai's abstract wisdom into practice in the real world.

This suggests the movement from the inner side to the outer side and represents the transformation of Dainichi Nyorai's abstract wisdom into practice in the real world.

sen.j: さらに、胎蔵曼荼羅は、中央・右・左の3つのブロックに分けて考えることが必要である。
sen.e: Further, Garbha-mandala should be seen by dividing it into three blocks, namely center, right and left block.

sen.j: 図の中央部は大日如来の悟りの世界を表わし、向かって左（方位では南）には聖観自在菩薩（観音菩薩）を主尊とする蓮華部院（観音院）、向かって右（方位では北）には金剛薩埵（こんごうさった）を主尊とする金剛手院（金剛部院, 薩埵院) がある。
sen.e: The center block represents the world of Dainichinyorai's state of Satori while Rengebu-in (Kannon-in Temple), whose principal statue is Shokanjizai Bosatsu (Kannon Bosatsu), is located on the observers's left (south in terms of direction) and Kongoshu-in (Kongobu-in or Satta-in), whose principal statue is Kongosatta, is located on the observers's right (north in terms of direction).
sen.cmt: 聖観自在菩薩→Shokanjizai Bosatsu観音院→Kannon-in Temple金剛薩埵（こんごうさった）→Kongosatta金剛部院→Kongobu-in 金剛手院→Kongoshu-in 薩埵院→Satta-in
sen.e: The center block represents the world of Dainichinyorai's state of Satori while Rengebu-in (Kannon-in Temple), whose principal statue is Shokanjizai Bosatsu (Kannon Bosatsu), is located on the observers's left (south in terms of direction) and Kongoshu-in (Kongobu-in or Satta-in), whose principal statue is Kongosatta, is located on the observers's right (north in terms of direction).

The center block represents the world of Dainichi Nyorai's state of enlightment while Rengebu-in (Kannon-in), whose principal statue is Shokanjizai Bosatsu (Kannon Bosatsu), is located on the observers' left (south in terms of direction) and Kongoshu-in (Kongobu-in or Satta-in), whose principal statue is Kongosatta, is located on the observers' right (north in terms of direction).
sen.cmt: スペルなど修正しました。

sen.j: 蓮華部院は如来の「慈悲」を、金剛手院は如来の「智慧」を表わすものとされている。
sen.e: It is believed that Rengebu-in represents Nyorai's mercy and Kongoshu-in represents Nyorai's wisdom respectively.
It is believed that Rengebu-in represents Nyorai's mercy and Kongoshu-in represents Nyorai's wisdom respectively.
It is believed that Rengebu-in represents Nyorai's 'mercy' and Kongoshu-in represents Nyorai's 'wisdom' respectively.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを補足しました。

sen.j: 胎蔵曼荼羅の各ブロックを「院」と称したのに対し、金剛界曼荼羅では「会」（え）という語が使われ、成身会（じょうじんえ）、三昧耶会（さまやえ）、微細会（みさいえ）、供養会、四印会、一印会、理趣会、降三世会（ごうざんぜえ）、降三世三昧耶会の九会（くえ）から成る。
sen.e: While each block of Garbha-mandala is called "in", the term of "E" is used in the case of Vajradhatumandala and it consists of Ku-e, namely Jojin-e, Samaya-e, Misai-e, Kuyo-e, Shiin-e, Ichiin-e, Rishu-e, Gozanze-e and Gozanze Samaya-e.
sen.cmt: 会（え）→E成身会（じょうじんえ）→Jojin-e三昧耶会（さまやえ）→Samaya-e微細会（みさいえ）→Misai-e供養会→Kuyo-e四印会→Shiin-e一印会→Ichiin-e理趣会→Rishu-e降三世会（ごうざんぜえ）→Gozanze-e降三世三昧耶会→Gozanze Samaya-e九会（くえ）→Ku-e
sen.e: While each block of Garbha-mandala is called "in", the term of "E" is used in the case of Vajradhatumandala and it consists of Ku-e, namely Jojin-e, Samaya-e, Misai-e, Kuyo-e, Shiin-e, Ichiin-e, Rishu-e, Gozanze-e and Gozanze Samaya-e.

While each block of Garbha-mandala is called 'in,' the term of 'E' is used in the case of Vajradhatu-mandala and it consists of Ku-e (nine e), namely Jojin-e, Samaya-e, Misai-e, Kuyo-e, Shiin-e, Ichiin-e, Rishu-e, Gozanze-e and Gozanze Samaya-e.

sen.j: これは9つのブロックと考えるよりも、9つの曼荼羅の集合体と考えるべきである。
sen.e: This should be understood as the aggregate of 9 mandara rather than 9 blocks.

sen.j: 中心になる成身会の中尊は金剛界大日如来（左手の人差し指を右手の拳で包み込む「智拳印」をむすぶ）である。
sen.e: The principal statue of Jojin-e, which is located in the center, is Kongokai Danichinyorai (who is in a posture of "Chiken-in" wiwith wrapping the forefinger of left hand by the fist of right hand).

sen.j: 大日如来の東・南・西・北には阿閦如来（あしゅく）・宝生如来・阿弥陀如来・不空成就如来の4如来が位置する（大日・阿閦・宝生・阿弥陀・不空成就を合わせて金剛界五仏あるいは五智如来という）。
sen.e: Ashuku- nyorai, Hosho- nyorai, Amida-nyorai and Fukujoju-nyorai are located at east, south, west and north of Dainichinyorai respectively (Dainichi, Ashuku, Hosho, Amida and Fukujoju are collectively called Kongokai-gobutsu or Gochi-nyorai).
sen.cmt: 阿閦如来（あしゅく）→Ashuku- nyorai宝生如来→Hosho- nyorai[kotobank]不空成就如来→Fukujoju-nyorai金剛界五仏→Kongokai-gobutsu, Five Buddhas of the Diamond world五智如来→Gochi-nyorai, Five Wisdom nyorai, Tathagatas[http://www.aisf.or.jp/%7Ejaanus/]
sen.e: Ashuku- nyorai, Hosho- nyorai, Amida-nyorai and Fukujoju-nyorai are located at the east, south, west and north of Dainichinyorai respectively (Dainichi, Ashuku, Hosho, Amida and Fukujoju are collectively called Kongokai-gobutsu or Gochi-nyorai).

Ashuku Nyorai, Hosho Nyorai (Ratnasambhava, one of the Five Wisdom Buddhas), Amida Nyorai and Fukujoju Nyorai (Amoghasiddhi, one of the Five Wisdom Buddhas) are located at the east, south, west and north of Dainichi Nyorai respectively (Dainichi, Ashuku, Hosho, Amida and Fukujoju are collectively called Kongokai-gobutsu or Gochi-nyorai).

sen.j: 各如来の東・南・西・北には四親近菩薩（ししんごんぼさつ）という、それぞれの如来と関係の深い菩薩が配されている。
sen.e: At the east, south, west and north side of each Nyorai, Bosatsu that are closely related to each Nyorai, called Shishingon Bosatsu, are located.

sen.j: 三昧耶会、微細会、供養会は中央の成身会とほぼ同様の構成をもっており、四印会はそれをやや簡略化したもの、一印会は他の諸仏を省いて大日如来一尊で表わしたものと考えて大過ない。
sen.e: Samaya-e, Misai-e and Kuyo-e have almost same composition with that of Jojin-e located in the center and it is no mistake that Shiin-e is the simplified version of the above and Ichiin-e is the one which ommits other Buddah than Dainichinyorai.

sen.j: 曼荼羅画面向かって右の理趣会、降三世会、降三世三昧耶会のそれぞれの中尊は大日如来ではなく、理趣会は金剛薩埵、あとの2つは降三世明王が中尊である。
sen.e: The principal statues of Rishu-e, Gozanze-e and Gozanze Samaya-e, which are located at the right side of mandara, are not Dainichinyorai but Kongosatta for Rishu-e and Gozanze Myoo for other two.

sen.j: 菩薩の一員である金剛薩埵や恐ろしい形相をした降三世明王も、すべては大日如来の悟りが形を変えて現われたものであり、すべては大日如来一尊に由来するということを表現したものと思われる。
sen.e: Kongosatta, who is counted as one of Bosatsu, and Gozanze Myoo, who has a fierce look, are believed to be the reincarnation of Dainichinyorai after attaining the state of Satori and this depiction represents the belief that everything derives solely from Dainichinyorai.

Kongosatta, who is counted as one of the Bosatsu, and Gozanze Myoo, who has a fierce look, are believed to be the reincarnation of Dainichi Nyorai after attaining the state of enlightment and this depiction represents the belief that everything derives solely from Dainichi Nyorai.

sen.j: 胎蔵曼荼羅が真理を実践的な側面、現象世界のものとして捉えるのに対し、金剛界曼荼羅では真理を論理的な側面、精神世界のものとして捉えていると考えられる。
sen.e: It is perceived that while Garbha-mandala grasps the truth as the matter of real world from practical aspect, Vajradhatumandala grasps the truth as the matter of spiritual world from theoretical aspect.

It is perceived that while Garbha-mandala grasps the truth as matter of the real world from practical aspects, Vajradhatumandala grasps the truth as the matter of spiritual world from theoretical aspects.
